FuncDef:
The tftp-server ipv6 acl command configures the ACL to control the access of clients to the FTP server.
The undo tftp-server ipv6 acl command cancels the configuration of the ACL.
By default, the ACL is not configured for the TFTP client.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the IPv6 ACL number.
ACL number is an integer data type. The basic acl number value ranges from 2000 to 2999, the advanced acl number value ranges from 3000 to 3999.

Specifies the ACL6 name.
The value is a string of 1 to 64 case-sensitive characters without spaces. The value must start with a letter (a to z or A to Z, case sensitive).

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If a device serves as a TFTP client, you can configure the ACL on the device to control the login of the local device to the TFTP server through TFTP.
If no rule is configured, the incoming and outgoing calls are not restricted after the command tftp-server acl is run.
Precautions
If no rule is configured, the incoming and outgoing calls are not restricted after the command tftp server acl is run.
